covered: Valid Request: TC01 and TC02 demonstrate successful updates with HTTP 204 for minimal and full payloads.
Partial Update: TC03/TC04/TC15/TC19 demonstrate updates when some fields are null or only a subset of fields are provided (including treatNullAsReset semantics in TC03).
Non-Existing Resource: TC08 demonstrates 400 with account not found.
Authorization / Headers: TC05 ensures 400 when CreatedBy header is missing; TC09 ensures 401 for missing/invalid token.
Input Validation: TC06 (invalid accountId format), TC07 (invalid account data), TC18 (malicious input), TC21 (unexpected input formats).
Handling of extra fields: TC10 confirms extra fields are ignored and only supported fields are updated.
Empty body: TC11 proves 400 when request body is empty.
System error: TC12 demonstrates 500 when DB is unavailable.
Large payload: TC13 tests large payload handling and performance.
Timeout / slow network: TC14 tests response under high latency or timeout conditions.
Integration / dependent services: TC16 verifies propagation to dependent services.
Concurrency: TC17 verifies concurrent updates and final state consistency.
Boundary / regression: TC20 tests min/max values; TC15 confirms field-level update semantics (email only).
Extra query parameters: TC22 allows ignoring extra query parameters or updating as expected.
gaps: 403 Forbidden coverage is not explicitly tested (insufficient permissions despite valid authentication).
Rate limiting / throttling tests are not present.
Caching behavior tests (ETag, Cache-Control) for PUT responses are missing.
Duplicate submission / idempotency scenarios are not covered.
TreatNullAsReset parameter value validation (invalid types) is not tested.
Observability / logging / auditing checks are not covered.
Edge-case for malformed header values (invalid X-Killbill-CreatedBy) is not tested.
Additional heavy concurrency or failure-in-mid-update scenarios are not covered.
recommendations: Add a 403 Forbidden test to cover authorized-but-not-permitted cases.
Add rate-limiting tests to verify behavior under burst PUT load.
Add caching verification (ETag/Cache-Control) and cache invalidation checks on PUT responses.
Add a duplicate submission test to ensure idempotency.
Add tests for invalid treatNullAsReset parameter values (non-boolean, missing).
Add observability and auditing checks around update operations, including error propagation tests.
Test malformed header values for X-Killbill-CreatedBy and other headers.
Extend concurrency testing to scenarios with database failure during update to assess ACID properties.
